chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
D: cpo
s: chain D
x: Poset.sort D

Goal:
(forall y : D, y \In s -> y <== x) -> lim s <== x

Premises:
sort = fun t : cpo => let (sort, _, _) := t in sort : cpo -> Type sort is a coercion
Notation Poset T m := (Poset.pack id)
Record chain (T : Poset.Exports.poset) : Type := Chain { pred_of : Pred T; _ : chain_axiom pred_of } Arguments Chain [T pred_of]
Notation lim := @CPO.lim
List.In : forall A : Type, A -> seq A -> Prop
CPOMixin : forall (T : Poset.Exports.poset) (mx_bot : T) (mx_lim : chain T -> T), (forall x : T, mx_bot <== x) -> (forall (s : chain T) (x : T), x \In s -> x <== mx_lim s) -> (forall (s : chain T) (x : T), (forall y : T, y \In s -> y <== x) -> mx_lim s <== x) -> mixin_of T
supM : forall (T : lattice) (s : Pred T) (x : T), (forall y : T, y \In s -> y <== x) -> sup s <== x
LatticeMixin : forall (T : Poset.Exports.poset) (mx_sup : Pred T -> T), (forall (s : Pred T) (x : T), x \In s -> x <== mx_sup s) -> (forall (s : Pred T) (x : T), (forall y : T, y \In s -> y <== x) -> mx_sup s <== x) -> Lattice.mixin_of T
Record mixin_of (T : Poset.Exports.poset) : Type := Mixin { mx_bot : Poset.sort T; mx_lim : chain T -> T; _ : forall x : T, mx_bot <== x; _ : forall (s : chain T) (x : T), x \In s -> x <== mx_lim s; _ : forall (s : chain T) (x : T), (forall y : T, y \In s -> y <== x) -> mx_lim s <== x } Arguments Mixin [T mx_bot] [mx_lim]%function_scope (_ _ _)%function_scope
infM : forall (T : lattice) (s : Pred_Class) (x : T), (forall y : T, y \In s -> x <== y) -> x <== inf s
Mem_map_inv : ?x \In [seq ?f i | i <- ?s] -> exists y : ?T, ?x = ?f y /\ y \In ?s where ?T : [D : cpo s : chain D x : D |- Type] ?T' : [D : cpo s : chain D x : D |- Type] ?f : [D : cpo s : chain D x : D |- ?T -> ?T'] ?x : [D : cpo s : chain D x : D |- ?T'] ?s : [D : cpo s : chain D x : D |- seq ?T]
limP : forall (s : chain D) (x : D), x \In s -> x <== lim s
Record mixin_of (T : Poset.Exports.poset) : Type := Mixin { mx_sup : Pred T -> T; _ : forall (s : Pred T) (x : T), x \In s -> x <== mx_sup s; _ : forall (s : Pred T) (x : T), (forall y : T, y \In s -> y <== x) -> mx_sup s <== x } Arguments Lattice.Mixin [T] [mx_sup]%function_scope (_ _)%function_scope
sub_supM : forall (T : lattice) (s : Pred T) (C : sup_closed s) (u : Pred (subPoset s)) (x : subPoset s), (forall y : subPoset s, y \In u -> y <== x) -> sub_sup C u <== x
poset_asym : forall (T : Poset.Exports.poset) (x y : T), x <== y -> y <== x -> x = y
PosetMixin : forall (T : Type) (mx_leq : T -> T -> Prop), (forall x : T, mx_leq x x) -> (forall x y : T, mx_leq x y -> mx_leq y x -> x = y) -> (forall x y z : T, mx_leq x y -> mx_leq y z -> mx_leq x z) -> Poset.mixin_of T
prop_supM : forall (s : Pred Prop) (p : propPoset), (forall q : Prop, q \In s -> q <== p) -> prop_sup s <== p
poset_trans : forall (T : Poset.Exports.poset) (y x z : T), x <== y -> y <== z -> x <== z
fun_supM : forall (A : Type) (B : lattice) (s : Pred (A -> B)) (p : A -> B), (forall q : A -> B, q \In s -> q <== p) -> fun_sup s <== p
dapp_mono : forall x0 : ?A, monotone (@^~ x0) where ?A : [D : cpo s : chain D x : D |- Type] ?T : [D : cpo s : chain D x : D |- ?A -> Poset.Exports.poset]
ideal_supM : forall (T : lattice) (P : T) (s : Pred (ideal P)) (p : idealPoset P), (forall q : ideal P, q \In s -> q <== p) -> ideal_sup s <== p
InE : forall T : Type, (forall x y : T, x \In [:: y] <-> x = y) * (forall (y : T) (s : seq T) (x : T), x \In y :: s <-> x = y \/ x \In s) * (forall (T0 : Type) (x : T0) (p : Simpl_Pred T0), (x \In p) = p x)
pair_supM : forall (A B : lattice) (s : Pred (A * B)) (p : A * B), (forall q : A * B, q \In s -> q <== p) -> pair_sup s <== p
app_mono : forall x0 : ?A, monotone (@^~ x0) where ?A : [D : cpo s : chain D x : D |- Type] ?T : [D : cpo s : chain D x : D |- Poset.Exports.poset]
sup_appE : forall (A : Type) (B : lattice) (s : Pred (A -> B)) (x : A), sup s x = sup [Pred y | exists f : A -> B, f \In s /\ y = f x]
prop_supP : forall (s : Pred Prop) (p : Prop), p \In s -> p <== prop_sup s
In_cons : forall (T : Type) (y : T) (s : seq T) (x : T), x \In y :: s < -> x = y \/ x \In s
infP : forall (T : lattice) (s : Pred_Class) (x : T), x \In s -> inf s <== x
fun_supP : forall (A : Type) (B : lattice) (s : Pred (A -> B)) (p : A -> B), p \In s -> p <== fun_sup s
sup_dappE : forall (A : Type) (B : A -> lattice) (s : Pred (dfunLattice B)) (x : A), sup s x = sup [Pred y | exists f : dfunLattice B, f \In s /\ y = f x]
supP : forall (T : lattice) (s : Pred T) (x : T), x \In s -> x <== sup s
dfun_supM : forall (A : Type) (B : A -> lattice) (s : Pred (dfunPoset (fun x : A => B x))) (p : dfunPoset (fun x : A => B x)), (forall q : dfunPoset (fun x : A => B x), q \In s -> q <== p) -> dfun_sup s <== p
dfun_asym : forall (A : Type) (B : A -> Poset.Exports.poset) (x : forall x : A, B x) (y : forall x0 : A, B x0), dfun_leq x y -> dfun_leq y x -> x = y
fun_asym : forall (A : Type) (B : Poset.Exports.poset) (x y : A -> B), fun_leq x y -> fun_leq y x -> x = y
ideal_asym : forall (T : Poset.Exports.poset) (P : T) (x y : ideal P), ideal_leq x y -> ideal_leq y x -> x = y

```coq
intros H.
apply CPOMixin.
- apply D.
- intro s; intros x Hx.
  apply limP.
  apply Hx.
- intro s; intros x Hx.
  apply H.
Qed.
```

original: intros H. apply CPOMixin. - apply D. - intro s; intros x Hx. apply limP. apply Hx. - intro s; intros x Hx. apply H.
